intro: Scabrita, commonly known as the scabrous plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its rough, often hairy leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Scabrita species are often found in Mediterranean climates and parts of southern Europe. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
